data.title: Patrick Hernandez
Livre: DJ, écrivain, cinéaste: Sven Hansen-Love
data.summary:
"Un emploi sur mesure" est le premier roman du DJ et ex-star de la French Touch, Sven Hansen-Love. Le narrateur du livre, un citoyen lambda, devient agent secret bas-de-gamme et évolue dans une sorte de brume ouatée existentielle: il ne comprend ni son job, ni sa vie. Sven Hansen-Love signe un premier roman très abouti, maîtrisé et qui se déploie hors de ses pages: sur le web, avec un site, plusieurs profils sur les réseaux sociaux, et un court-métrage produit par l'auteur. 
Sven Hansen-Love est au micro de Linn Levy.

data.title: Rends ton plan, sur Beeeeeeeeh! (1/5)
data.summary:
Ca bêle de bonheur sur Bex et ses hauteurs ensoleillées avec un guide de hot montagne: Vincent Veillon en personne, oui, le mari de Vincent Kucholl!  Ce pur produit local, qui en a dans le tiroir,  nous emmène pour une sacrée balade dans la région avec l'Argentine au fond des jumelles. C'est en se pinçant les bretelles que Pippolo et Dujaja rencontrent en sa compagnie un paysan d'altitude qui préfère les apéros aux écrans, ainsi qu'un  éleveur de chèvres mélomanes sensibles au "Cabri, c'est fini" d'Hervé Villars-sur-Ollon. Sans oublier le mystérieux Tounet, lequel les invite dans son chalet creusé dans un champignon géant. Qui parle.

data.title: La PDC Viola Amherd pourrait-elle succéder à Doris Leuthard au Conseil fédéral?
data.summary:
La présidente des femmes PDC suisse, Babette Sigg, affiche son ambition pour qu'une femme succède à l'actuelle conseillère fédérale démocrate chrétienne Doris Leuthard. Viola Amherd, avocate de profession et depuis 13 ans au Conseil national, pourrait avoir le profil idéal.

* * La PDC Viola Amherd pourrait-elle succéder à Doris Leuthard au Conseil fédéral?  
Intro : 
"Nous souhaitons que Doris Leuthard soit remplacée par une politicienne ouverte, libérale et sociale." Propos signée Babette Sigg dans le Temps ce matin. La présidente des femmes PDC suisse affiche son ambition pour qu'une femme succède l'actuelle conseillère fédérale démocrate chrétienne. Bonsoir Stéphane Deleury, vous êtes l'un de nos correspondants au Palais fédéral. Est-ce que les femmes PDC ont les moyens de leurs ambitions ? 
Papier : 
Alors ce sera  difficile de faire élire une femme pour succéder à Doris Leuthard... Le PDC n'a qu'un siège au gouvernement.. après douze ans de représentation féminine on imagine les hommes PDC piaffer d'impatience... Doris Leuthard Elle même hier dans la NZZ disait que le sexe de son successeur n'était pas une priorité. D'un autre coté si l'Argovienne devait être remplacée par une femme, il ne resterait que Simmonetta Sommaruga au Gouvernement. Une situation jugée inacceptable par beaucoup... et ça plaide pour 
***On l'a dit, Babette Sigg veut une femmes libérale, ouverte et sociale... Est-ce que ce profil existe dans les rangs PDC ? 
Alors il n'y en a pas des dizaines... mais  une correspond assez  bien au portrait robot. C'est Viola Amherd... depuis 13 ans déjà au Conseil national... avocate de profession. Elle affiche une énorme expérience politique avec notamment 20 ans passé à l'executif de la ville de Brig. C'est plus que Vladimir Poutine à la tête de la Russie.... J'ai demandé à Viola Amherd si le PDC devait présenter une ticket entièrement féminin pour la succession de Doris Leuthard écoutez sa réponse. 
SON : 25'' part du PF
"Doris Leuthard ne s'est pas encore retirée"... voilà on a affaire là typiquement à une réponse de personne qui est ntéressée mais qui ne veulent pas encore l'avouer... 
***Admettons qu'elle se retrouve sur le ticket, Viola Amherd a-t-elle des chances de devenir l'une des 7 sages ? 
Oui c'est possible... mais vous savez comme le chemin est tortueux et plein d'inatendu... Elle a clairement la carrure me disent les élus de gauche qui salue son pragmatisme et sa capacité à travailler avec tous.

chapters.title: TV5M Dans la peau d'un jeune patron
chapters.excerpt: Fondateur de la chaîne d'opticiens Visilab, Daniel Mori reste investi à tous les niveaux de son entreprises. L'ex-skieur Bernhard Russi apprécie son implication. L'idée de faire des lunettes rapidement est venu des USA ou Daniel Moria étudié avec son cousin Jean-Philippe de Toledo actuel président de la Pharmacie principale. Le rachat d'une partie de l'entreprise par le géant de l'optique néerlandais Grandvision est vu comme une opportunité pour s'étendre sur Internet.

chapters.title: TTC MORI 2805 PAD_RTS000001492864
chapters.excerpt: L'aéroport de Genève Cointrin est très prisé par les milliardaires qui se déplacent en Jet privés. Leurs avions qui sont souvent des modèles commerciaux transformés en cabines volantes de luxe ne sont pas immatriculés en Suisse mais dans des paradis fiscaux. Ces avions privés qui coûtent très chers échappent ainsi à la TVA des pays de l'Union européenne ou de Suisse dont ils utilisent les infrastructures.

chapters.title: TTC JETS PRIVES 2805 PAD_RTS000001492859
chapters.excerpt: L'entreprise de paiement en ligne PayPal a racheté la start-up suédoise iZettle inventeur d'une solution de paiement facilité pour les commerçants pour près de 2,2 milliards de dollars.  la société iZettle est désormais qualifiée de Licorne.

chapters.title: TTC IZETTLE 2805 PAD_RTS000001492793
chapters.excerpt: L'école privée Institut Florimont organise un concours pour ses élèves dans le but de favoriser l'esprit d'entreprise. En 2018 les élèves doivent imaginer une campagne de recherche de fond pour le navire hôpital Mercy Ships. Le directeur suisse de l'ONG Rebé Lehmann souhaite que les jeunes puisses ainsi sensibiliser d'autres jeunes à travers les nouveaux réseaux sociaux de communication. Alexandre Demont Head of social entrepreneurship at TFT estime que leur travail est déjà producteur de valeur.

chapters.title: TTC ENFANTS ENTREPRENEURS 2805 PAD_RTS000001492817
chapters.excerpt: Préprod à base d'archives sur l'ex-champion olympique d'escrime 1976 Thomas Bach devenu président du Comité olympique CIO.

chapters.title: TTC BIG BOSS BACH 2805 PAD V2_RTS000001492923

sequences.summary: Plateau : Itw Giovanni Ferro Luzzi, professeur Unige et HEG.

Images GVA Spotter de Bourkhan un Airbus A340 quadriréacteur privé se posant à Genève. 
Itw Nolan Jungo, photographe, détaillant les avions privés se posant à Genève. Gros plan des immatriculation des avions dans des paradis fiscaux. Itw François Pilet, journaliste. Airbus A319 du milliardaire Dmitri Rybolovlev se posant à Genève Cointrin. Itw André Schneider, PDG de Genève Aéroport.

data.title: STRADA - Roland Garros. 2018.05.28

data.summary: Emission décentralisée à Genève pour l'émission hors studio de Couleurs locales avec Julien von Roten qui fait découvrir des lieux de Suisse romande en lien avec l'actualité du jour.
subTitles:
00:00:33:05  00:01:02:10
...

00:01:02:12  00:01:03:22
-Bonjour.

00:01:04:00  00:01:06:11
J'espère
que votre week-end a été bon.

00:01:06:12  00:01:10:10
Aujourd'hui, 3ème émission
sur la mobilité dans les centres.

00:01:10:12  00:01:13:04

et des cyclistes.

00:01:13:06  00:01:16:05
Ce soir, on s'intéresse

00:01:16:07  00:01:18:10
Cohabitation sur les trottoirs,

00:01:18:12  00:01:20:19

00:01:20:21  00:01:23:12
Les piétons ont des droits

00:01:23:13  00:01:26:09
On le verra avec nos invités
ici à Genève,

00:01:26:11  00:01:29:19

00:01:29:21  00:01:32:02
Au sommaire aussi,

00:01:32:04  00:01:36:08
notre nouvelle série
qui vous emmène aux frontières.

00:01:36:10  00:01:40:08
-Voici la conscience parfois
de nos autorités,

00:01:40:10  00:01:43:00
mais on n'ose pas le dire.

00:01:43:02  00:01:47:08
-Et on découvrira le coin de paradis
de la directrice artistique

00:01:47:10  00:01:51:00
du théâtre populaire romand
à La Chaux-de-Fonds.

00:01:51:02  00:01:52:14
Voilà le programme.

00:01:52:16  00:01:56:18
Les températures sont idéales
pour aller se promener en ville.

00:01:56:20  00:01:59:21

après vos Infos du jour.

00:02:02:22  00:02:07:06
-Vétérinaires, éleveurs et autorités
s'inquiètent toujours plus

00:02:07:08  00:02:11:07

des bactéries aux antibiotiques.

00:02:11:09  00:02:13:07

00:02:13:09  00:02:17:12
par une médication jugée excessive
pour les animaux d'élevage.

00:02:17:14  00:02:20:10
Désormais,
les vétérinaires ont une charte

00:02:20:12  00:02:23:07
qui prévoit d'éviter
les antibiotiques.

00:02:23:09  00:02:26:10
-On espère donner un unisson

00:02:26:12  00:02:29:05
pour le bien de la santé publique.

00:02:29:07  00:02:33:22
Tout le monde doit agir
et trouver des solutions.

00:02:34:16  00:02:38:18
-Cette stratégie s'inscrit
dans le programme fédéral StAR,

00:02:38:20  00:02:42:22
qui veut lutter contre

00:02:43:11  00:02:45:01
-En 2016,

00:02:45:03  00:02:49:14

à rouler en ville de Sion (VS).

00:02:49:16  00:02:53:20
Toujours en test, elles peuvent
désormais gérer automatiquement,

00:02:53:22  00:02:56:15
mais sous surveillance,
les carrefours.

00:02:56:16  00:02:59:23
Leur système communique
avec des feux adaptés,

00:03:00:01  00:03:04:04
qui indiquent leur position
et l'état de la signalisation.

00:03:04:06  00:03:07:17
Une avancée impérative
pour les véhicules autonomes.

00:03:07:18  00:03:11:15
Prochaine étape: gérer le trafic
dans les ronds-points.

00:03:13:15  00:03:24:08
...

00:03:24:10  00:03:27:03
-On est à Genève
et ça grouille de piétons.

00:03:52:05  00:03:53:20

00:05:27:01  00:05:33:06
A Genève, on a voté l'initiative 144

00:05:33:08  00:05:39:12
qui oblige d'aménager
des pistes cyclables.

00:05:39:13  00:05:43:20
Si les cyclistes ne peuvent rouler
en sécurité,

00:05:43:22  00:05:49:12
ils ont tendance à se reporter
sur les trottoirs.

00:05:49:13  00:05:53:16
Ca, ça pose problème.

00:05:53:18  00:05:56:01
-C'est pas que les vélos.

00:05:56:03  00:06:00:11
Il a aussi les Segways,
les trottinettes...

00:06:00:12  00:06:05:13
-Les outils qui permettent
le déplacement évoluent.

00:06:05:15  00:06:10:02
Ils ont tendance
à se reporter sur les trottoirs.

00:06:10:04  00:06:14:04
C'est le point
que notre pétition souhaite régler

00:06:14:06  00:06:21:01
avec le Conseil fédéral et l'OFROU.

00:06:21:03  00:06:25:23
-Il y a 60 morts par année
sur les routes suisses.

00:06:26:01  00:06:31:20
On peut rappeler des règles de base.

00:06:31:22  00:06:35:06
-On ne peut utiliser clairement
ces statistiques,

00:06:35:08  00:06:37:19
car on n'a pas tous les éléments.

00:06:37:21  00:06:42:09
A Genève, il y a eu deux décès
causés par des cyclistes.

00:06:42:11  00:06:45:13
Avec délit de fuite.

00:06:45:15  00:06:53:11
Il faut que les piétons ne traversent
pas n'importe quand et où.

00:06:53:12  00:07:01:12
-C'est simple,
on regarde des deux côtés.

00:07:01:14  00:07:05:07
-Les seniors ont d'autres problèmes.

00:07:05:09  00:07:14:16
Ils prennent des raccourcis parfois
car c'est plus simple pour eux.

00:07:14:18  00:07:18:02
-Merci, bonne journée.

00:07:21:14  00:07:25:02
Vous avez déjà entendu parler
des escape rooms,

00:07:25:04  00:07:29:01
ces chambres où on vous enferme
et d'où il faut s'échapper

00:07:29:03  00:07:30:22
en résolvant des énigmes.

00:07:31:00  00:07:34:08
De nombreux Romands
se sont lancés dans l'aventure.

00:07:34:10  00:07:38:03
C'est notre rubrique
"Jeunes poussent".

00:07:48:05  00:07:51:21
-A partir de maintenant,
vous faites ce que je vous dis.

00:07:51:23  00:07:53:23
Alignez-vous contre le mur !

00:07:54:07  00:07:55:17
-Une escape room

00:07:55:19  00:07:58:07
est un jeu d'évasion grandeur nature.

00:07:58:09  00:08:00:12
On est dans la prison Alcatraz.

00:08:00:13  00:08:03:16
Ici, dans le chalet de grand-mère.

00:08:03:18  00:08:09:09
Les gens ont une heure pour résoudre
les énigmes de la pièce et en sortir.

00:08:09:11  00:08:11:18
On est trois associés.

00:08:11:20  00:08:16:18
Stéphanie, la créatrice, est venue
nous chercher avec Guillaume.

00:08:16:20  00:08:19:17
On est dans la partie technique.

00:08:19:23  00:08:23:06
-Vous allez m'avouer votre crime.

00:08:23:11  00:08:26:11
La tueuse de frère, au coin !

00:08:26:12  00:08:32:12
Seules les personnes aux deux mains
attachées peuvent s'en sortir...

00:08:32:18  00:08:36:11
-Ils ont payé entre 30 et 50 frs
pour se faire enfermer.

00:08:36:12  00:08:39:13
Ils n'ont que leur cerveau
pour s'en sortir.

00:08:39:18  00:08:42:04
-On développe davantage de pièces.

00:08:42:06  00:08:44:04
On en a quatre actuellement.

00:08:44:06  00:08:47:08
Le but est d'arriver à sept pièces.

00:08:48:04  00:08:52:03
-Je m'appelle Diane Mueller,
je suis la peintre décoratrice.

00:08:52:05  00:08:55:09
Je vais avoir
un domaine d'application

00:08:55:11  00:08:57:06
sur les murs.

00:08:57:08  00:09:00:19
Je crée une ambiance, un univers.

00:09:02:13  00:09:05:10
-On a commandé 600 kg
de plantes plastique.

00:09:05:12  00:09:08:04
On les positionne
pour faire la jungle.

00:09:08:06  00:09:10:00
Ca prend du temps.

00:09:10:02  00:09:14:08
C'est des centaines de milliers
de francs pour cette pièce.

00:09:14:18  00:09:18:03
-L'an dernier,
30'000 personnes ont joué à Charrat.

00:09:18:05  00:09:21:08
Problème: une fois
l'énigme d'une pièce résolue,

00:09:21:10  00:09:22:21
inutile d'y rejouer.

00:09:22:23  00:09:26:05
Il faut renouveler les salles
et innover.

00:09:26:14  00:09:30:23
-Dans "Jurassic Jones", il y aura
des aventuriers, des dinosaures.

00:09:31:01  00:09:34:13
Avec la 360,
on s'immergera dans ce monde.

00:09:35:03  00:09:38:13
-Benoît est aussi cofondateur
dans le même bâtiment

00:09:38:16  00:09:42:15
d'une entreprise
spécialisée en réalité virtuelle.

00:09:42:22  00:09:46:10
-Ca les met en condition
avant d'être dans la pièce.

00:09:46:12  00:09:48:11
Ils auront eu l'impression

00:09:48:12  00:09:51:03
d'avoir été transportés

00:09:51:05  00:09:53:05
dans un univers.

00:09:54:12  00:09:57:19
-La vingtaine d'employés
ne sont pas tous à 100 %.

00:09:57:21  00:10:04:03
On a des étudiants, des gens
que pour le week-end ou le soir.

00:10:04:18  00:10:07:04
-Le concept est tendance.

00:10:07:06  00:10:15:08
Tout le défi sera sur le long terme
de garder captifs les joueurs.

00:10:17:15  00:10:28:14
...

00:10:28:16  00:10:31:02
-Bonjour, Madame.
-Bonjour.

00:10:31:04  00:10:33:17
-C'est simple d'être piéton
à Genève ?

00:10:33:19  00:10:35:06
-Pas facile.

00:10:35:08  00:10:37:22
Très difficile de temps en temps.

00:10:38:00  00:10:41:22
-Qu'est-ce qui est difficile ?
-Les gens ne respectent rien.

00:10:42:00  00:10:43:17
-Il y a beaucoup de vélos,

00:10:43:19  00:10:46:15
de trottinettes,
de planches à roulettes...

00:10:46:17  00:10:50:14
-Le plus grand risque,
c'est les cyclistes.

00:10:50:16  00:10:54:16
Les vélos électriques arrivent vite.

00:10:54:18  00:10:59:10
-Ca roule n'importe comment.
-Donnez-nous un peu de soleil !

00:11:03:23  00:11:07:18
-Bonjour, vous allez bien ?
-Très bien.

00:11:07:20  00:11:11:18
-Les piétons
connaissent des difficultés.

00:11:11:20  00:11:17:14
Vous parlez au nom
des personnes âgées et handicapées.

00:11:17:16  00:11:20:12
-Ces dernières années,

00:11:20:13  00:11:22:05
la ville s'est adaptée

00:11:22:07  00:11:25:07
aux personnes âgées.

00:11:25:09  00:11:30:10
Les handicapés, eux,
ont un lobby très fort.

00:11:30:12  00:11:43:08
-A Genève, les gens ne respectent
pas toujours les feux de circulation.

00:11:43:10  00:11:45:19
-En Suisse allemande,

00:11:45:21  00:11:50:08
je m'approche d'un passage à piétons
et les voitures ralentissent.

00:11:50:10  00:11:53:17
A Genève, c'est comme en France.

00:11:53:19  00:11:56:12
A vélo, je m'arrête

00:11:56:13  00:12:01:17
mais je me fais doubler
par une voiture.

00:12:01:20  00:12:11:01
Il faut un plaidoyer pour le respect
pour l'usager plus faible.

00:12:11:03  00:12:14:17
-Merci beaucoup, très bonne semaine.

00:12:17:18  00:12:22:12
Des Suisses internés pour mauvaises
moeurs, alcoolisme ou prostitution:

00:12:22:14  00:12:25:16
jusqu'en 1981,
cela existait en Suisse.

00:12:25:18  00:12:29:07
Des historiens ont cartographié
ce pan d'histoire.

00:12:29:09  00:12:33:19
C'est le premier reportage
de notre série "A la frontière".

00:12:36:07  00:12:40:03
-Vous êtes ici
en internement administratif ?

00:12:40:05  00:12:41:18
-Oui.

00:12:41:19  00:12:44:01
-Pour la 1ère fois ?
-La 2ème.

00:12:44:03  00:12:46:22
-Vous n'avez jamais été condamné ?
-Non.

00:12:47:00  00:12:50:19
-Qu'est-ce qui s'est passé
pour qu'on vous interne ?

00:12:50:21  00:12:56:03
-Je buvais des verres
et j'allais pas travailler.

00:12:57:01  00:12:58:23
-Interné pour fainéantise.

00:12:59:01  00:13:02:13
Jusqu'en 1981,
c'était possible en Suisse.

00:13:02:22  00:13:07:09
-Qui vous a interné ?
-Les autorités du Locle.

00:13:07:21  00:13:11:09
-Une décision d'une autorité
tutélaire sans jugement,

00:13:11:11  00:13:13:19
et la vie d'un individu basculait.

00:13:14:01  00:13:17:03
-C'est des personnes
des classes défavorisées

00:13:17:05  00:13:19:11
sans travail fixe.

00:13:19:12  00:13:21:16
Ou qui scandalisent

00:13:21:18  00:13:24:07
par leur comportement
ou leur tenue.

00:13:24:09  00:13:26:08
Il y a aussi des prostituées.

00:13:26:10  00:13:28:15
La prostitution
n'est pas illégale

00:13:28:17  00:13:31:22
mais les autorités
veulent "nettoyer la rue".

00:13:32:04  00:13:36:12
-La norme du travail,
du comportement non choquant domine.

00:13:36:13  00:13:38:16
Des chercheurs ont cartographié

00:13:38:18  00:13:43:05
650 établissements
actifs de 1933 à 1980.

00:13:44:01  00:13:49:13
-On voit la collaboration
entre les cantons.

00:13:49:15  00:13:55:02
Il y a des établissements de travail,
des pénitenciers...

00:13:55:04  00:13:57:13
Tous les types qui ont accueilli

00:13:57:15  00:14:00:07
des internés administratifs.

00:14:01:07  00:14:03:10
-Des cartes interactives,

00:14:03:12  00:14:07:08
bien plus qu'un simple outil
pour les premiers concernés.

00:14:08:11  00:14:11:10
-Les anciens internés

00:14:11:12  00:14:16:21
retrouvent des informations
sur les établissements.

00:14:16:23  00:14:19:15
Et grâce à notre analyse du réseau,

00:14:19:17  00:14:23:08
on voit la logique des placements.

00:14:26:00  00:14:31:02
-Une logique financière notamment,
qu'on dénonçait déjà en 1970.

00:14:31:17  00:14:35:12
-L'internement administratif
est institué davantage

00:14:35:14  00:14:40:12
pour protéger les autorités
que pour protéger les individus.

00:14:40:13  00:14:45:12
Pour protéger contre les dépenses.

00:14:45:13  00:14:50:10
Là est parfois la conscience

00:14:50:12  00:14:55:22
de nos autorités,
mais on n'ose pas le dire.

00:14:56:13  00:14:58:01
-Cette histoire

00:14:58:04  00:15:00:12
doit nous faire réfléchir

00:15:00:13  00:15:05:07
à la pertinence du fait d'enfermer
pour résoudre un problème.

00:15:05:14  00:15:09:12
-Une solution qui aura concerné
au moins 40'000 personnes.

00:15:09:14  00:15:12:19
Ces nouvelles cartes permettront

00:15:12:21  00:15:16:14
d'éclairer le passé peu glorieux
de notre pays.

00:15:18:09  00:15:20:13
-Pour terminer cette émission,

00:15:20:15  00:15:23:00
découvrons le petit coin de paradis

00:15:23:02  00:15:27:10
d'Anne Bisang, directrice artistique
du Théâtre populaire romand.

00:15:27:12  00:15:30:03
Direction La Chaux-de-Fonds !

00:15:31:21  00:15:43:04
...

00:15:43:06  00:15:45:11
-Nous sommes à L'Heure bleue,

00:15:45:12  00:15:48:12
le théâtre à l'italienne
de La Chaux-de-Fonds,

00:15:48:14  00:15:50:17
construit en 1837.

00:15:51:13  00:15:54:16
Nous sommes ici au dernier balcon

00:15:54:18  00:15:58:19
qui était plutôt réservé

00:15:58:21  00:16:03:10
aux couches modestes
de la population.

00:16:05:09  00:16:09:07
J'aime venir ici de temps en temps.

00:16:09:09  00:16:17:02
C'est ici que je trouve qu'on entend
le mieux le silence du théâtre.

00:16:17:04  00:16:22:05
Un silence qui contraste avec
l'animation lors des représentations.

00:16:22:07  00:16:28:03
On ressent cette énergie
accumulée à travers les temps,

00:16:28:05  00:16:33:15
les générations de spectateurs
qui ont partagé des émotions ici.

00:16:33:17  00:16:40:10
...

00:16:40:12  00:16:46:10
Ceux qui ont offert
à la population ce théâtre,

00:16:46:12  00:16:51:04
ce sont des riches horlogers.

00:16:51:06  00:16:54:06
Ils avaient repéré

00:16:54:08  00:16:58:16
lors de leurs voyages des lieux
semblables comme la Scala de Milan.

00:16:58:18  00:17:01:21
Ils ont voulu offrir
la même chose chez nous.

00:17:01:23  00:17:07:14
Ils ont voulu doter La Chaux-de-Fonds
d'un magnifique lieu de culture.

00:17:07:16  00:17:18:01
Ce fait marque l'attachement
de La Chaux-de-Fonds à la culture.

00:17:24:05  00:17:26:01
-Fin de cette émission.

00:17:26:03  00:17:29:21
On se retrouve demain à Genève,
dans les airs cette fois.

00:17:30:00  00:17:33:07
On vous parlera
du business de l'aviation d'affaire

00:17:33:09  00:17:36:09
à l'occasion de l'ouverture
du salon Ebace.

00:17:36:11  00:17:39:20
On rencontrera
un collectionneur un peu particulier.

00:17:40:02  00:17:44:00
-J'avais la flemme d'en faire neuf,
alors j'en ai fait quatre.

00:17:44:10  00:17:46:10
-Vous pouvez nous contacter

00:17:46:12  00:17:48:13
sur Facebook ou par courrier.

00:17:48:15  00:17:53:04
Je vous retrouve demain,
excellente soirée !

00:17:53:06  00:17:59:20
Sous-titrage SWISS TXT:
M.D'Auria, J.Cloux

chapters.title: FRIGO CL NE CPARADIS ANNE BISANG CLEAN_RTS000001470126
chapters.excerpt: Visite de l'Heure bleue, le Théâtre populaire romand de la Chaux-de-Fonds, en compagnie de d'Anne Bisang, directrice artistique du TPR.

chapters.title: FRIGO CL FR SERIE FRONTIERE CARTES DETENUS ADMINISTRATIFS CF_RTS000001490596
chapters.excerpt: Des chercheurs ont cartographiés plus de 650 établissements d'internement administratif suisses, actifs de 1933 à 1980. Des cartes interactives qui seront un outil pour les historiens mais aussi pour les victimes d'internement. Avec les interviews de Anne-Françoise Praz, professeure d¿histoire contemporaine Université Fribourg et de Ernst Guggisberg, docteur en histoire.

chapters.title: CL FRIGO JPOUSS VS ESCAPE ROOM CF_RTS000001418634
chapters.excerpt: De nombreuses entreprises se sont lancées dans la création d'"Escape room", une activité à la mode auquel certaines jeunes entreprises ont ajouté des prologues en réalité virtuelle.

chapters.title: CL BREVES
chapters.excerpt: Dans le canton de Fribourg, les vétérinaires auront une charte pour lutter contre la résistance aux antibiotiques, un phénomène renforcé par une utilisation parfois trop large des antibiotiques sur les animaux d'élevage.

sequences.summary: Itw de Patrick Lacourt, président du groupe Mbilité piétonne à genève

Images en noir et blanc d'une entrée dans une "escape room" sur le thème de la prison d'Alcatraz. 
Itw de Benoît Eberlé, co-fondateur de Trapgame à Charrat dans le Valais.
Itw de Diane Mueller. décoratrice de Trapgame.
Itw de Fabien Valour, réalisateur d'effets spéciaux.
Itw de Peter graf, militant du mouvement pro-aînés.

Int de l'Heure bleue, le Théâtre populaire romand de la Chaux-de-Fonds.
Itw d'Anne Bisant, directrice artistique du Théâtre populaire Romand (TPR).
Lustre, sculptures et peintures vues depuis le poulailler du théâtre à l'italienne.

data.title: Roland Garros 2018 - 1er tour : Rafaël Nadal - Simone Bolelli

chapters.title: Roland Garros 2018 : ENTOURAGE Jour 2
chapters.excerpt: Emission décentralisée depuis Paris pour le tournoi de tennis de Roland-Garros.

chapters.title: Roland Garros 2018 - 1er tour : Raphael Nadal (ESP) - Simone Bolelli (ITA) fin du match
chapters.excerpt: Victoire du joueur de tennis espagnol Rafael Nadal qui s'est imposé en 3 sets face à l'Italien Simone Bolelli au 1er tour des Internationaux de France à Roland-Garros, sur le score de 6-4, 6-3 et 7-6 . Le match a été interrompu par la pluie.

Locuteur FS2 (1:00:28 > 1:00:34) [98%] : 
Info trafic RTS en collaboration avec les CFF et le TCS.


Locuteur FS3 (1:00:36 > 1:01:02) [90%] : 
La matinée sera nuageuse, avec un peu de pluie par moment cet après- midi un temps plus variable avec parfois de belles éclaircies, surtout en pleine mais des averses isolées sont toujours possibles, côté mercure 14 à 15 degrés en ce moment 24 cet après- midi 27 en Valais demain, même type de temps, il fera un peu plus frais et puis la suite de la semaine est à l'avenant, toujours aussi instable, la météo avec Der créateur d'intérieur et passion cuisine qui vous accueillent dans leur Showroom à Lutry.


Locuteur MS20 (1:01:03 > 1:01:49) [88%] : 
Éric Guevara frais bonjour bonjour romaine, tout un monde d'ici 10 minutes, quel est votre programme, on a parlé un petit peu des prochaines Coupes du monde de football mais en diagonale, nous irons à Kaliningrad avait me regardez pas comme ça, c'est honteux, sur les chemins de travers, nous irons à Kaliningrad avec Isabelle cornes qui nous parlera de de de comment cette cette enclave russe dans l'Union européenne se s'insère dans la Fédération de Russie, une histoire assez passionnante d'ailleurs Kaliningrad ce sera landers 11 sites hôtes de la Coupe du monde et puis nous irons aussi au Qatar, où les entreprises qui sont accusés les entreprises engagées dans la construction des stades, des hôtels, etc, qui sont accusés de de pratique quasi esclavagistes essaie de redorer leur blason, d'organiser une Coupe du monde, des ouvriers, ce sera juste après le journal exactement bonne émission elle merci, bonne journée à vous romaine, il est 8 heures une sur la première voici.


Locuteur MS6 (1:01:51 > 1:02:26) [93%] : 
Foued Boukari, le sujet a beau être consensuel, il reste difficile de le mettre en oeuvre les femmes sont toujours bien moins payées que les hommes, l'égalité professionnelle sera au coeur de la session des Chambres fédérales qui débute aujourd'hui, c'est l'homme dont l'Italie va parler aujourd'hui Carlo Cottarelli il devrait être chargé de former un gouvernement de transition par le président italien le portrait dans quelques minutes, de cet ancien cadre du FMI, alias Monsieur, ciseaux, pour son rôle dans la réduction des dépenses publiques et puis l'édition 2018 de Roland Garros, a débuté hier avec un tableau féminin très ouvert et un Rafaël Nadal archi- favori chez les hommes.


Locuteur MS30 (1:02:28 > 1:02:51) [92%] : 
La session des Chambres fédérales s'ouvre cet après- midi à Berne, elle sera placée sous le signe de l'égalité femme 2 objets liés à cette thématique seront débattus durant les 3 prochaines semaines, l'obligation pour les entreprises de plus de 50 employées de procéder tous les 4 ans et une évaluation des salaires et les quotas de femmes à la tête de grandes entreprises, des débats qui se tiendront Stéphane Delory, dans un contexte particulier.


Locuteur MS31 (1:02:51 > 1:03:54) [93%] : 
Dire que les femmes sont impatients d'obtenir des avancées dans leur combat pour obtenir dans les fêtes l'égalité inscrite dans la loi est un euphémisme, certaines parlent carrément de renouveler la grève des femmes, la révision de la loi sur l'égalité, qui avait été, par le Conseil des États en mars dernier avait provoqué un tollé qui transcendait les camps politiques, l'idée d'obliger les entreprises d'une certaine taille, à faire leur introspection salariales ne plaît toujours pas la droite libérale et conservatrice, ce débat très observé aura lieu demain mardi l'autre discussion aura lieu en 3ème semaine au Conseil national, il s'agit de renforcer la présence des femmes à la tête des entreprises cotées en bourse, le projet prévoit 30 pourcent de femmes dans les conseils d'administration et 20 pourcent dans les directions illustration de l'importance du moment pour la cause des femmes, les 2 conseillères fédérales ont donné des interviews très fort sur ce thème, ce week- end, une manière pour Simonetta Sommaruga au front lors de ces 2 débats et Doris Leuthard, de mettre un peu de pression sur les parlementaires pour qu'ils prennent la cause des femmes au sérieux.


Locuteur MS30 (1:03:54 > 1:04:07) [94%] : 
Et autre coup de pression dans ce dossier, celui du Parti socialiste, le PS menace de lancer une initiative populaire s'il n'y a aucune avancée pour la vice- présidente du parti et conseillère aux États vaudoise Géraldine Savary le Parlement est à présent pieds au mur.


Locuteur FT32 (1:04:07 > 1:04:46) [91%] : 
C'est surtout la cession de la dernière chance pour le Parlement suisse de montrer qu'il est attaché à l'égalité femme et à faire respecter la loi sur l'égalité, la Constitution fédérale, la première étape ce mardi au Conseil des États avec l'acceptation, la loi sur l'égalité pour faire en sorte qu'on agisse contre ces inégalités, cette discrimination envers les femmes d'abord annoncé que si cette loi sur l'égalité s'enlisait, par manque de volonté du Parlement où était refusé par socialiste poserait une initiative populaire à la chancellerie fédérale pour mettre un peu la pression sur le Parlement, faire en sorte que, on passe de la parole aux actes.


Locuteur MS30 (1:04:46 > 1:05:10) [90%] : 
Des propos recueillis par Stéphane Delory le Mouvement Citoyen Genevois en proie à des tensions internes va élire demain son président après les élections cantonales qui ont laissé des traces : le MCG, qui a perdu 9 sièges, ne conservant que 11 députés pour redresser le parti, ils sont donc 3 pour l'instant à se présenter officiellement la présidence dans un rock la présidente actuelle pour Sandro piste, chef du groupe MCG au Grand Conseil, un avocat n'a pas démérité.


Locuteur MT33 (1:05:10 > 1:05:19) [86%] : 
Alain Rocca un excellent travail avec les bombes avec ses candidats et que l'on peut continuer dans ce sens-là pour aller de l'avant pour les sujets qui nous attend.


Locuteur FS23 (1:05:19 > 1:05:25) [93%] : 
N'empêche : le MCG a quand même perdu pas mal de de sièges lors des dernières élections, forcément ça aiguise certains appétits.


Locuteur MT33 (1:05:25 > 1:05:56) [88%] : 
La carte bleue, Serge, elle est due entre autres au fait que ce sponsor avait lancé son parti le gel puisque le nous a raconté un certain nombre de suffrages, ce qui équivaut à quatre bois 5 sièges et ce n'est pas de la faute de la présidence ou du membre du bureau et le MCG on a subi les conséquences qui est important, c'est d'avoir une équipe unie Amarok a réussi à obtenir le quorum, elle a réussi à obtenir un siège, je pense qu'on n'a rien à lui reprocher et je pense qu'on doit continuer lagon dans le public et dans l'intérêt du canton.


Locuteur MS30 (1:05:56 > 1:06:01) [88%] : 
Des propos recueillis par Sylvie belles heures ils peuvent sauter sans aucun remords dans leur piscine, les militants de.

	Feature 3 – Laurie Cunningham
Born in London in 1956, Laurie Cunningham was a truly trailblazing black British footballer. The first English player to play for Real Madrid, Cunningham started the 1981 European Cup Final when Liverpool defeated Real Madrid. His niece, Rhodene Cunningham, reflects on his life and career.

Magazine Show 32 – Opener
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:00:53
	SOT: SERGIO RAMOS (SPANISH)
	
	HISTORICALLY, WE ARE THE TEAM WITH THE MOST CHAMPIONS LEAGUE TROPHIES. THAT’S NOT BY CHANCE.

	
	
	
	

	10:01:06
	SOT: JORDAN HENDERSON (ENGLISH)
	
	WE TAKE INSPIRATION FROM THE PAST PLAYERS AND THE PAST TEAMS THAT HAVE WON. THE MOST IMPORTANT THING FOR US IS CREATING OUR OWN HISTORY, AND GIVING EVERYTHING TO DO THAT. 

	
	
	
	

	10:01:19
	SOT: ZINEDINE ZIDANE (FRENCH)
	
	IT WON’T BE EASY, WE KNOW THAT, BUT WE’RE READY TO DO WHAT IT TAKES TO BECOME CHAMPIONS.

	
	
	
	

	10:01:35
	SOT: JÜRGEN KLOPP (GERMAN)
	
	WE’RE NOT BARCELONA, WE’RE NOT REAL MADRID OR BAYERN MUNICH. WE AREN’T ANYONE ELSE. WE ARE LIVERPOOL.

	
	
	
	

	10:01:52
	SOT: MARCELO (PORTUGUESE)
	
	YOU CONSTANTLY HAVE TO PROVE YOURSELF IN FOOTBALL. WHAT’S HAPPENED IN THE PAST DOESN'T COUNT.

	
	
	
	

	10:02:01
	SOT: MOHAMED SALAH (ARABIC)
	
	IF YOU WIN THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE THEN IT’S FOR EVERYBODY AROUND THE WORLD. NO MATTER WHERE THEY ARE FROM. THIS IS HUGE.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – Teases
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:02:25
	UCL Final
	
	This week, we reflect on an historic Champions League Final between Real Madrid and Liverpool.

	
	
	
	

	10:02:31
	UWCL Final
	
	A third consecutive European crown for Olympique Lyonnais in the UEFA Women’s Champions League.

	
	
	
	

	10:02:39
	Laurie Cunningham
	
	And a footballing trailblazer – the emotional story of Laurie Cunningham.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – Champions League Festival
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:02:56
	After music change
	
	In the lead-up to the 2018 UEFA Champions League Final, Kyiv city centre played host to the Champions Festival – a four-day event celebrating the competition’s rich history.

	
	
	
	

	10:03:11
	Woman up stairs
	
	Fans had the opportunity to get up close to the famous trophy ahead of the 63rd final in Europe’s premier club competition and the first to take place in Ukraine.

	
	
	
	

	10:03:26
	SOT: VOX POP FAN: (UKRAINIAN)
	
	WE ARE REALLY PROUD THAT THIS EVENT IS BEING ORGANISED HERE IN UKRAINE AND THAT SO MANY PEOPLE HAVE COME TO VISIT US. THE ATMOSPHERE IS INCREDIBLE AND I LOVE IT WHEN AN EVENT LIKE THIS IS HAPPENING IN MY COUNTRY.

	
	
	
	

	10:03:42
	SOT: VOX POP FAN: (UKRAINIAN)
	
	ALL THE FANS ARE BEING EXTREMELY ENERGETIC AND THIS MAKES THE ATMOSPHERE OUTSTANDING – I’M STRUGGLING TO FIND THE WORDS TO DESCRIBE HOW COOL EVERYTHING IS!

	
	
	
	

	10:03:57
	After SOT
	
	Anticipation for the final continued to build as thousands of eager fans gathered for the Ultimate Champions Tournament – an exhibition five-a-side knockout event between four teams all made up of UEFA Champions League legends. 




	
	
	
	

	10:04:15
	SOT: JERZY DUDEK (POLISH) 
	
	I’M REALLY HUMBLED THAT I CAN BE HERE TODAY WITH ALL THESE LEGENDS OF THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE. I DIDN’T EXPECT THERE TO BE SO MANY PEOPLE HERE. THIS WAS A FANTASTIC DAY – AND I THINK I SPEAK ON BEHALF OF ALL THE PLAYERS THAT CAME, TODAY BROUGHT BACK SOME WONDERFUL MEMORIES!

	
	
	
	

	10:04:35
	SOT: MÍCHEL SALGADO (SPANISH)
	
	I THINK KYIV IS A WONDERFUL CITY FOR THIS, EVERYBODY’S READY, AND AS WE’VE SEEN DURING THE LEGENDS GAME, THE FANS CAN’T WAIT FOR THE FINAL.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – UWCL Final
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:04:53
	Stadium floodlights
	
	On Thursday night, Kyiv also played host to the UEFA Women’s Champions League Final, with two-time defending champions Olympique Lyonnais facing German champions Wolfsburg.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:06
	Players off bus
	
	It was the third time in six seasons that the two sides had met each other in the showpiece. Lyon were aiming to secure a third consecutive title and become the first team to win the competition five times.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:21
	Teams out
	
	More than 14,000 fans gathered at the Valeriy Lobanovskyi Stadium.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:30
	After kick-off
	
	In a tense opening half-hour, goal-scoring opportunities proved hard to come by.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:37
	After w/s pitch
	
	Lyon, guided by Reynald Pedros, who made five UEFA Champions League appearances as a player for FC Nantes, began to dominate proceedings.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:54
	After photographer
	
	Goalless at half-time, Lyon, who won 21 of 22 domestic league matches this season, continued to create the best chances. In the 69th minute, Amandine Henry’s header was cleared off the line.

	
	
	
	

	10:06:11
	After fans
	
	Wolfsburg were under pressure, but goalkeeper Almuth Schult was resolute – denying Eugénie Le Sommer with seven minutes remaining.

	
	
	
	

	10:06:25
	After full-time whistle
	
	Goalless after 90 minutes – for the third consecutive season, the Final would go to extra time. 

	
	
	
	

	10:06:38
	After fade to black
	
	In the 93rd minute, Pernille Harder gave Wolfsburg the lead.  Just the seventh goal that Lyon had conceded in all competitions this season.

	
	
	
	

	10:06:48
	Scoreboard
	
	But for Wolfsburg, who had already clinched a domestic double, the joy was short-lived, as just three minutes later, Alexandra Popp was sent off for a second bookable offence.

	
	
	
	

	10:06:59
	Action
	
	Lyon pressed high up the pitch, and equalised almost immediately through Henry – her first Champions League goal since October 2012.

	
	
	
	

	10:07:12
	After celebs
	
	Just 12 seconds after the restart and Lyon, remarkably, had the lead – substitute Shanice van de Sanden creating the opportunity for Le Sommer.

	
	
	
	

	10:07:24
	After celeb
	
	Four minutes later, it was 3-1 – Ada Hegerberg with her 15th goal of the campaign; a new competition record.

	
	
	
	

	10:07:35
	Fans
	
	Four goals and a red card within the space of 10 breath-taking minutes, and there was still time for an incredible finale – Camille Abily, making a record 81st and final European appearance, came off the bench to score the game’s final goal.

	
	
	
	

	10:07:52
	After coach celeb
	
	A hat-trick of assists for Van de Sanden, who only came on as a substitute in extra time.

	
	
	
	

	10:08:10
	Full-time
	
	A remarkable 4-1 victory, Olympique Lyonnais: Champions of Europe for a record fifth time.




	
	
	
	

	10:08:17
	SOT: CAMILLE ABILY (FRENCH)
	
	THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE IS A SPECIAL COMPETITION AND I’VE WON IT FIVE TIMES, IT’S SIMPLY INCREDIBLE.

	
	
	
	

	10:08:28 
	SOT: ALEXANDRA POPP (GERMAN)
	
	MY RED CARD CHANGED THE GAME, BECAUSE THE TEAM WERE ALREADY TIRED BY THAT POINT. I’M VERY SORRY TO MY TEAMMATES THAT THIS HAPPENED, BUT WE MUST CONGRATULATE OUR OPPONENTS – THEY TOOK ADVANTAGE AND SCORED SOME GREAT GOALS.

	
	
	
	

	10:08:46
	SOT: ADA HEGERBERG (FRENCH)
	
	I’M REALLY PROUD OF THE TEAM AND THE WORK WE’VE DONE DAY IN, DAY OUT – IT WAS A VERY HARD ROAD, BUT WE’RE EUROPEAN CHAMPIONS!

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – Laurie Cunningham
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:09:08
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH) 
	
	THE STORIES I'VE HEARD IS THAT HE WAS JUST LIKE A FEATHER. HE WAS JUST GRACIOUS ON AND OFF THE PITCH, BUT ON THE PITCH, HE WAS A REALLY GOOD PLAYER.

	
	
	
	

	10:09:20
	After SOT
	
	Born in London to Jamaican parents, Laurence Paul Cunningham is one of football’s great pioneers.

	
	
	
	

	10:09:27
	Goal
	
	Having overcome racial barriers to realise his dream of becoming a professional footballer, Laurie Cunningham would excel during spells at Leyton Orient and West Bromwich Albion. His performances eventually caught the attention of Real Madrid, who signed the winger in 1979.

	
	
	
	

	10:09:46
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH) 
	
	WHEN HE BECAME THE FIRST ENGLISH PLAYER TO PLAY FOR MADRID, IT WAS FANTASTIC. NOT JUST FOR MY UNCLE, BUT FOR A BLACK PLAYER TO GO AND PLAY FOR ONE OF THE BIGGEST TEAMS IN THE WORLD, IT WAS LIKE WOW.

	
	
	
	

	10:10:04
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH) 
	
	HE JUST HAD THAT SOMETHING, THAT X-FACTOR, THEY WANTED HIM TO COME AND PLAY WITH THEM. BUT FOR HIM, HE JUST WANTED TO PLAY FOOTBALL.

	
	
	
	

	10:10:18
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH)
	
	WHEN I WENT TO REAL TO SEE HIM WITH MY GRANDMOTHER, THE ATMOSPHERE, EVERYTHING AROUND IT, WAS LIKE, "OH MY GOSH, ARE THEY ACTUALLY CHEERING FOR HIM?" I WAS LIKE, "WOW, THAT'S MY UNCLE." 




	
	
	
	

	10:10:34
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH)
	
	I'D RUN UP TO HIM, HE WOULD PICK ME UP AND I'D GIVE HIM A BIG HUG AND A SMILE. THAT'S WHEN I KNEW, "OK, YOU'RE IN YOUR ELEMENT NOW AREN’T YOU." HE DIDN'T HAVE TO SAY MUCH BUT I KNEW DEEP DOWN INSIDE HE WAS REALLY CHUFFED THAT HE'D PLAYED REALLY WELL.

	
	
	
	

	10:10:59
	After SOT
	
	In 1981, Cunningham helped Real Madrid reach the European Cup Final in Paris, where they faced Liverpool, who would win the match 1-0.

	
	
	
	

	10:11:10
	After action
	
	An England international, he would spend five years at Real, winning one La Liga and two Copa del Rey titles. 

	
	
	
	

	10:11:18
	Statue
	
	On the 15th of July 1989, Laurie Cunningham was involved in a fatal car accident in Madrid – he was just 33 years old.

	
	
	
	

	10:11:29
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH)
	
	I THINK FOR HIM, I DON'T THINK HE KNEW HOW BIG AND AMAZING HE WAS. TO OTHER PEOPLE, HE WAS PHENOMENAL. HE WAS A GREAT PLAYER, HE WAS THE BEST, THE WAY HE WAS WITH THE BALL AND THE WAY HE WAS WITH OTHER PEOPLE.

	

	
	
	

	10:11:53
	SOT: RHODENE CUNNINGHAM (ENGLISH)
	
	MY NAME IS RHODENE CUNNINGHAM – THE NIECE OF THE GREAT LAURIE CUNNINGHAM 

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – Still to come
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:12:03
	Real Madrid
	
	Still to come, history in Kyiv, as Real Madrid continue to augment their incredible legacy.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – Pre-Match & Fans
	
TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:13:13
	SOT: VINNIE JONES (ENGLISH)
	
	I COULD NOT IMAGINE NOT BEING HERE NOW. IT DOESN’T MATTER WHAT THE COST, YOU’VE JUST GOT TO SAY, “I’VE GOT TO GO TO KYIV”. HERE WE ARE ON THE BRINK OF SOMETHING, IT’S JUST AN INCREDIBLE, INCREDIBLE SITUATION THAT WE FIND OURSELVES IN.

	
	
	
	

	10:13:31
	SOT: GUSTAVO DELGADO MARTÍN (SPANISH)
	
	FOR US, IT’S THE MOST SPECIAL COMPETITION OUT THERE. EVERYONE KNOWS ABOUT DI STÉFANO, PUSKÁS, GENTO, WHO WERE AMAZING, BUT I THINK WHAT THIS GENERATION OF PLAYERS HAVE DONE, IS REALLY DIFFICULT. I THINK THIS TEAM IS UP THERE WITH THE BEST.

	
	
	
	

	10:13:49
	SOT: VINNIE JONES (ENGLISH)
	
	PEOPLE SAY, “OH, IT’S ONLY A FOOTBALL MATCH.” IT’S NOT. THERE’S FAR MORE TO IT THAN THAT. IT’S OUR EVERYDAY, IT’S THE WAY WE LIVE. WE EAT, DRINK, SLEEP FOOTBALL. THAT’S JUST THE WAY IT IS AND IT’S NOT GOING TO CHANGE. 

	
	
	
	

	10:14:03
	SOT: GUSTAVO DELGADO MARTÍN (SPANISH)
	
	EVERYONE’S SAYING IT’LL BE REALLY DIFFICULT TO WIN A THIRD IN A ROW, BUT IF ANYONE CAN DO IT THEN REAL MADRID CAN. FOR THIS GROUP OF PLAYERS, IF THEY WIN THEIR THIRD CONSECUTIVE EUROPEAN CUP, THEY’LL GO DOWN IN FOLKLORE.




	
	
	
	

	10:14:20
	SOT: VINNIE JONES (ENGLISH)
	
	EVERYONE KNOWS WHAT HAPPENED IN ISTANBUL 2005, IT WAS JUST ABSOLUTELY OFF THE SCALE. 
BUT, IF WE WIN THIS AND MAKE THIS NUMBER 6, 
I’LL DIE HAPPY, IT’S AS SIMPLE AS THAT. THAT’S HOW MUCH IT MEANS TO US.

	
	
	
	

	10:14:34
	SOT: GUSTAVO DELGADO MARTÍN (SPANISH)
	
	MY NAME IS GUSTAVO DELGADO MARTÍN AND I’VE BEEN A REAL MADRID FAN FOR 42 YEARS.

	
	
	
	

	10:14:41
	SOT: VINNIE JONES (ENGLISH)
	
	MY NAME IS VINNIE JONES, AND THIS IS MY FOURTH EUROPEAN CUP FINAL.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – UCL Final
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:14:53
	On team arrivals
	
	The 2017/18 UEFA Champions League season reached its climax in Kyiv as Real Madrid and Liverpool, with 17 European Cups between them, faced each other at the NSC Olimpiyskiy Stadium.

	
	
	
	

	10:15:08
	On warm-ups
	
	For defending champions Real, Zinedine Zidane selected the same line-up as in the 2017 Final – with Isco once again preferred to Gareth Bale.  

	
	
	
	

	10:15:20
	On Liverpool warm-ups
	
	Liverpool’s 11, with an average age of 26 years and 170 days, was the youngest to start a Final since Jürgen Klopp’s Borussia Dortmund in 2013.

	
	
	
	

	10:15:33
	Teams out
	
	Cristiano Ronaldo, leading the competition’s scoring charts for a sixth consecutive season, was looking to score in a fourth Champions League Final. Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah had scored 34% of their goals in all competitions.

	
	
	
	

	10:15:50
	After
	
	With an estimated global audience of 160 million watching on, the stage was set.

	
	
	
	

	10:15:58
	Alexander-Arnold cross – 4 mins 
	
	Liverpool pressed high and were on the front foot early on.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:05
	Ronaldo shot over – 16 mins
	
	As Real settled into the game, controlling possession in midfield, Ronaldo went close to his 16th goal of the Champions League season.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:15
	Alexander-Arnold shot saved – 23 mins
	
	But Klopp’s side continued to attack – 19-year-old Trent Alexander-Arnold leading the charge.




	
	
	
	

	10:16:23
	Salah injury – 25 mins
	
	Until a pivotal moment in the 25th minute – after a clash with Sergio Ramos, Salah was injured.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:32
	Salah substitution – 30 mins
	
	After attempting to play on, Liverpool’s attacking talisman was eventually forced to leave the game and was replaced by Adam Lallana.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:42
	Carvajal substitution – 36 mins
	
	Six minutes later and Real’s Dani Carvajal suffered the same fate with a hamstring problem – the second time he had succumbed to injury in a Champions League Final.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:54
	Benzema offside goal – 43 mins
	
	With the holders now in the ascendancy, Karim Benzema had a goal ruled out for offside shortly before the break. A tense, goalless first half came to a close.

	
	
	
	

	10:17:11
	After aerial
	
	Real began the second half with the swagger of a team convinced of their destiny.

	
	
	
	

	10:17:16
	On Isco shot
	
	And within four minutes rattled Loris Karius’ woodwork…

	
	
	
	

	10:17:21
	On Isco head in hands
	
	Isco, so close to his first goal of the European campaign.

	
	
	
	

	10:17:27
	On fans
	
	Just three minutes later, the defending champions took the lead. Liverpool’s 24-year-old goalkeeper with a catastrophic error that led to Karim Benzema’s 56th competition goal.

	
	
	
	

	10:17:43
	On Benzema celeb
	
	Not since Zinedine Zidane in 2002 had a Frenchman scored in the Champions League Final.




	
	
	
	

	10:17:55
	On Klopp
	
	Jürgen Klopp’s side took just four minutes to respond. Sadio Mané restoring parity from close range, becoming just the fourth African player to score in a European Cup Final.

	
	
	
	

	10:18:13
	On Marcelo
	
	But Real have a resilience and talent in abundance. Unfazed, they continued to dominate in midfield with Luka Modrić and Toni Kroos combined completing more passes than Liverpool’s entire midfield and attack.

	
	
	
	

	10:18:28
	On Isco shot
	
	Isco threatened again, before being replaced by Gareth Bale after 61 minutes.

	
	
	
	

	10:18:36
	On photographer
	
	The Welshman had started just 26 times for Real all season, but took just 122 seconds to leave his mark on the 2018 Final in spectacular fashion…

	
	
	
	

	10:18:48
	On Marcelo cross
	
	From Marcelo’s cross, his extraordinary finish illuminated Kyiv and put Real one-step closer to their objective.

	
	
	
	

	10:19:06
	On Liverpool fans
	
	In the stands, and on the pitch, Liverpool were stunned, but they had to try and respond again.

	
	
	
	

	10:19:14
	On Mané
	
	Mané – the first Senegalese player to appear in a Champions League Final – almost became the first player to score 11 times from their first 11 matches in the competition.

	
	
	
	

	10:19:27
	On wide shot of fans
	
	Real’s grip on the European Cup was tightening.

	

	
	
	

	10:19:31
	On fans
	
	Not since Franz Roth for Bayern 42 years ago had a player scored in consecutive European Cup Finals. Ronaldo came so close to emulating that feat…




	
	
	
	

	10:19:43
	On Zidane signalling
	
	As Zidane’s players continued to exude class, completing 91% of their passes on the night, committing just five fouls.

	
	
	
	

	10:19:53
	On Bale
	
	From Bale’s cross, Benzema tested Karius, whose night was about to get even worse.

	
	
	
	

	10:20:01
	On Klopp
	
	Seven minutes remained when Bale took aim from distance. Karius’ failure to repel the shot capped a truly calamitous evening.

	
	
	
	

	10:20:13
	On Bale celeb
	
	Bale had become the first substitute to score twice in a Final in the competition’s 63-year history.

	
	
	
	

	10:20:22
	On Liverpool fans
	
	It finished 3-1.

	
	
	
	

	10:20:26
	On Real Madrid fans
	
	Real Madrid: Champions of Europe for the 13th time.

	
	
	
	

	10:20:32
	On Zidane celeb
	
	For Zidane, it’s a ninth trophy in less than three years. He joins Bob Paisley and Carlo Ancelotti on the list of coaches to have won the competition three times. Zidane, however, is the only coach to win three consecutive finals.

	

	
	
	

	10:20:54
	SOT: ZINEDINE ZIDANE (FRENCH)
	
	WE’RE WRITING EVEN MORE HISTORY FOR THIS CLUB THANKS TO THIS SQUAD AND WHAT THEY HAVE ACHIEVED, WHAT WE’VE ACHIEVED IN THE LAST THREE SEASONS – WINNING THREE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE TITLES. I FEEL PHENOMENAL!

	
	
	
	

	10:21:12
	After SOT
	
	For Liverpool, it was a second European Final defeat in three seasons under Jürgen Klopp, who has now lost six consecutive finals in all competitions.




	
	
	
	

	10:21:26
	SOT: JÜRGEN KLOPP (ENGLISH)
	
	YOU NEED A LITTLE BIT OF LUCK IN A FOOTBALL GAME ESPECIALLY IN A FINAL WE HAD NOT ONLY NO LUCK, WE HAD BAD LUCK. YOU HAVE TO ACCEPT THAT AND WE WILL CARRY ON. WE SEE ALL THE SITUATIONS AND THINK, “WOW, HOW DID THAT ALL HAPPEN TONIGHT?” BUT THE GAME IS OVER AND WHATEVER I COULD SAY THE RESULT WILL NOT CHANGE.

	
	
	
	

	10:21:47
	SOT: GARETH BALE (ENGLISH)
	
	IT’S QUITE SURREAL LOOKING BACK AND TRYING TO GRASP WHAT WE HAVE JUST ACHIEVED, THE HISTORY WE HAVE MADE. IT’S AN INCREDIBLE FEELING LIFTING THE TROPHY AGAIN AND, OBVIOUSLY, I AM DELIGHTED.

	
	
	
	

	10:21:58
	SOT: SERGIO RAMOS (SPANISH)
	
	I FEEL PROUD OF MYSELF AND MY TEAMMATES, WHO MADE IT POSSIBLE FOR ME TO MAKE HISTORY BY CAPTAINING THE TEAM TO THREE CONSECUTIVE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE VICTORIES.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 32 – Closer
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:22:14
	From top
	
	Real Madrid: champions of Europe for a fourth time in five seasons, nine months after 32 teams began their journeys in what has been another spectacular season in the UEFA Champions League.

	
	
	
	

	10:22:54
	After Ancelotti shot
	
	New faces made an impact.

	
	
	
	

	10:22:57
	SOT: COMMENTARY (AZERI)
	
	PEDRO, PEDRO!

	
	
	
	

	10:23:05
	On Mourinho
	
	Familiar ones returned.

	
	
	
	

	10:23:40
	On Buffon save
	
	In the Knockout Phase, the game’s biggest stars took centre-stage.

	
	
	
	

	10:23:50
	On Ben Yedder goal
	
	There were shocks.

	
	
	
	

	10:23:52
	UPSOT (SPANISH)
	
	SEVILLA ARE CHAMPIONS!

	
	
	
	

	10:23:56
	SOT: COMMENTARY (ENGLISH)
	
	HE CAN HIT ONE, OH HE CAN HIT ONE.

	
	
	
	

	10:24:03
	Ronaldo goal
	
	Moments of genius.

	
	
	
	

	10:24:11
	Di Francesco B-Roll
	
	And an incredible comeback as eight became four.

	
	
	
	

	10:24:18
	SOT: COMMENTARY (ITALIAN)
	
	3-0 ROMA! MANOLAS 

	
	
	
	

	10:24:29
	SOT: COMMENTARY (ENGLISH)
	
	OH, MO SALAH!

	
	
	
	

	10:24:32
	
	
	Real Madrid and Liverpool were the final two teams standing.

	
	
	
	

	10:24:36
	SOT: COMMENTARY (ENGLISH)
	
	THAT’S IT, KYIV HERE THEY COME.

	
	
	
	

	10:24:49
	After SOT 
	
	The kings retained their crown… again.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END

data.title: Source : L'équipe d'Espagne - Stade Fisht à Sochi - Lionel Messi et Cristiano Ronaldo - Guillermo Ochoa 2014 - but de Salif Diao lors de la Coupe du monde 2002 - l'équipe d'Egypte - Coupe du monde Afrique du Sud 2010
scripts:
Road to the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ 

Programme 15 

 

Edit     17/05/2018 

Voice Over    Simon Allix & Alex Gordon-Martin 

Part 1    00:26:05 

 

Time Code   Contents 

10:00:00   Opening Titles 

10:00:26   Show Menu 

10:00:39   Team Profile – Spain 

10:09:33   Venue Guide – Fisht Stadium, Sochi 

10:10:54   Ones To Watch – Messi (ARG) // Ronaldo (POR) 

10:12:49   World Cup Memories – Guillermo Ochoa MEX (2014) 

10:14:45   Hyundai Anatomy of a Goal– Salif Diao SEN (Korea/Japan 02) 

10:17:07   Team Profile – Egypt 

10:23:37   FIFA World Cup™ Firsts – South Africa 2010 

10:25:32   Teaser 

10:25:40   Closer 

10:26:05   Show Ends 

 



1 
 

 

Road to the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ 

Show 15 

 

10:00:23 This is the Road to the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ 

 

10:00:26 Coming up today we meet Group A’s African challengers - Egypt 

 

10:00:31 Look at two stars set to light up the tournament this summer 

 

10:00:34 And replay a sensational goal from the 2002 FIFA World Cup™ 

 

10:00:39 We start the show 3,400 km west of Moscow to take a close look at the 

champions of South Africa 2010. 

 

10:00:49 Spain, who were ranked 6th at the time of the draw, have been ever present 

at the FIFA World Cup™ since 1978, making 14 appearances and winning in 

2010. 

 

10:01:00 Known as the perennial underachievers for almost half a century, they finally 

produced on the biggest stage of all. In South Africa 8 years ago, La Roja 

would hypnotise their opponents with their intricate passing style nicknamed 

‘Tiki-Taka’, reaching the final against the Netherlands. In extra-time the 

talismanic Andres Iniesta scored the decisive goal to put this great team into 

the history books. 

 



2 
 

10:01:28 The road to the 2018 finals was successful as ever for Spain having not lost a 

FIFA World Cup™ qualifier since 1993. Placed in UEFA qualifying group G 

alongside fellow European heavyweights Italy, they were dominant dropping 

just two points across 10 games, the highlight a 3-0 win against the Azzurri. 

 

Julen Lopetegui, Coach 

10:01:48 Well, overall it was positive. Naturally, it was a really tough group, where 

only the winner would qualify directly, and in this case, Italy was in the 

group, Spain was in the group, and other teams who also could have really 

done some damage and well, in the end, fortunately it was us who qualified 

directly. 

 

Sergio Ramos, Defender 

10:02:11 I think every game we played was a big occasion and difficult. So, I didn't 

for one moment find it an easy campaign – quite the opposite. But I think 

we've forged a very good, ompact and balanced team thanks to all the hard 

work put in over recent years, which ultimately gave us a solid platform to 

shine. 

 

David De Gea, Goalkeeper 

10:02:37 I think we had a really great qualifying campaign all around. My highlight 

would probably be the Italy game at the Bernabéu. We saved our most 

complete performance for the toughest match. Above all, we’re pleased our 

hard work paid off. We trained well, we did all the right things, and I 

obviously relished the prospect of playing in Russia. It doesn't get much 

bigger for a Spanish player than wearing the Spain shirt at a World Cup. 

 

10:03:07 Tactically, Spain set up in a 4-3-3 with David de Gea in goal, Sergio Ramos and 

Gerard Pique anchoring the defence and a surplus of talented midfielders 

including the veteran Andres Iniesta, who’ll be looking for one final 

swansong.  



3 
 

 

10:03:22 Spearheading the attack they have the option of Iago Aspas, Diego Costa, or 

Isco.   

 

10:03:29 The Real Madrid player has found his feet with the senior squad, as have 

several of those who won the 2013 European Under-21 Championship under 

the tutelage of Julen Lopetegui. 

 

David De Gea, Goalkeeper 

10:03:41 We largely focus on our own game. We aim to keep the ball and play it 

around, to make the opposition run and tire themselves out chasing the 

ball. This is the crux of our approach: we try to have as much possession as 

possible, and when we lose the ball, we go flat out to press and win it back 

as soon as possible, pinning our opponents back in their half. I think those 

are our strengths. 

 

Sergio Ramos, Defender 

10:04:09 We still want to dominate games and have as much possession as possible, 

and through that, we're rekindling the enthusiasm and ambition that Spain 

displayed in previous tournaments, and especially when we managed to lift 

the European Championship and World Cup trophies. 

 

10:04:29 In the process, we've got ourselves fired up again and are once more 

showcasing our trademark brand of football. 

 

10:04:39 The man who led them to their great successes was Vicente del Bosque. 

However a managerial change has reinvigorated a side that was in decline 

after it failed to defend its world title in 2014. At the age of 51, and without 

much experience as a coach at elite level, Lopetegui has managed to 

conserve the essence of what made Spain so successful. 

 

 



4 
 

 

Julen Lopetegui, Coach 

10:05:00 We’re happy with the response we’ve had from the players; their 

determination, their passion, their commitment, which is really important 

for being able to put everything together. Then, being capable of competing 

to the best of their ability. 

 

10:05:13 It’s really good to be able to look back, to thank the best generation of 

players in the history of Spanish football, one of the best generations, I 

think, maybe even in the world ever. But now that’s over and we’ve still got 

some of those players, as well as some new younger players that have 

come along, and we’re trying to mix the two generations together.  

 

10:05:31 The star player of the team is Sergio Ramos. With over 150 caps he is the 

leader of the side and a defender of genuine world class ability. A master at 

the art of defending, the Spaniard also has an eye for goal having scoring 13 

times for his country.  

 

David De Gea, Goalkeeper 

10:05:48 I think the word 'leader' sums him up. He's a leader on and off the pitch. 

He's a fantastic captain with a wealth of experience who’s played a lot of 

games at international and club level. He's really good on the ball, he's very 

quick, and he marshals the defence very well. He's one hell of a centre-

back. 

 

Sergio Ramos, Defender 

10:06:09 I'm lucky enough to have experienced magnificent, unique moments and to 

have won every team prize out there in football. Above all, I think I've been 

very good at maintaining that ambition, drive and enthusiasm. If I wake up 

one day without that enthusiasm, the time will be right to just stay at 

home, but while playing football still fills me with such excitement, I'll keep 



5 
 

dedicating hour upon hour to performing at the highest level. If you do 

that, anything's possible. 

 

10:06:36 If Spain’s opponents manage to get past Ramos, they will come up against 

David De Gea, a goalkeeper who could well prove to be their x-factor in 

Russia. 

 

Sergio Ramos, Defender 

10:06:45 He's risen to the top, to the highest level, becoming the No1 for club and 

country, and I think he's in fabulous form. He shows that game in, game 

out. Having him in goal for Spain gives us a safety net, because he's a 

keeper who reads the game really well, who helps us bring the ball out, as 

he's so good with his feet, and is very strong in the air too. 

 

10:07:05 David is a very complete goalie, and how far he goes in the future is in his 

hands. 

 

David De Gea, Goalkeeper 

10:07:13 I've got a number of games under my belt now, I'm earning my stripes and 

I'll strive to keep my place, do as well as possible and, most importantly, 

win trophies.  

 

10:07:24 Drawn in Group B, Spain kick off their FIFA World Cup™ against European 

Champions Portugal on the 15th June at the Fisht Stadium, Sochi. The match-

up between these Iberian rivals is arguably the tie of the group stages.  

 

Sergio Ramos, Defender 

10:07:39 We'd have liked to face each other later in the competition, but I think 

Portugal, as the reigning European champions, are also raring to go and to 

show that they didn't win the European Championship by chance. We know 

that they've got a great team. Obviously, Cristiano Ronaldo is their 



6 
 

marquee player, and I've always said that he's a truly top-class player both 

for Real Madrid and for his country. 

 

10:08:01 I just hope his finishing against Spain isn't as good as when we're playing 

together at club level! 

 

10:08:08 Spain will also meet Morocco and the Islamic Republic of Iran. Two teams 

with impressive defensive records on their road to Russia. 

 

David De Gea, Goalkeeper 

10:08:16 There are no bad teams or minnows at a World Cup. Everyone has good 

players and everyone will be fighting tooth and nail in pursuit of victory. So, 

you've got to play very well to progress. 

 

Julen Lopetegui, Coach 

10:08:27 Well, we don’t look to the past to feed our desires, or our ambitions. We 

look to the future or we look at the present. We have enough motivations 

in the present day in order to confront the challenge that is the World Cup, 

with that desire, that willpower, that ambition. And we feed off that 

energy, the excitement, that something like the World Cup creates and the 

idea of being challengers in a World Cup. That’s enough to keep us 

motivated. 

 

David De Gea, Goalkeeper 

10:08:52 Expectations tend to be very high in Spain. We're in great shape and we've 

got to make it count. I think it's a good opportunity to show that Spain 

are up there again. We've got very good players, and we want to get things 

right. 

 

 



7 
 

Sergio Ramos, Defender 

10:09:07 On a personal level, it'd mean having lifted practically every trophy as 

captain, and it would make me a two-time world champion, which is no 

small feat. I don't think many other players in football history can say that. 

Here's hoping that this summer, I'll be able to do it. Nothing would make 

me prouder than lifting the trophy again. 

 

10:09:33 Now, we’re taking a look at the stadium where Spain kick off their Russia 

2018 campaign against group B seeds Portugal. 

 

10:09:41 The Black sea resort of Sochi lies 1,600 Kilometres south of Moscow and is 

known as the gateway to the Russian Riviera. 

 

10:09:49 Located in the city’s Imeretin Valley, the 48,000 capacity Fisht stadium was 

built to host the opening and closing ceremonies of the 2014 Winter Olympic 

and Paralympic Games. 

 

10:10:01 Originally built as an indoor arena, the stadium has been opened up with 

views of Mount Fisht and the Krasnaya Mountains to the North and the Black 

Sea to the South. 

 

10:10:11 After the Stadio Olimpico in Turin, Italy, the Fisht arena will become only the 

second stadium to host both the Winter Olympics and the FIFA World Cup™. 

 

10:10:21 The venue hosted four matches at last summer’s FIFA Confederations Cup 

including Germany’s hat-trick of victories over Australia, Cameroon and 

Mexico. The World Champions scored 10 goals in the process. 



8 
 

10:10:34 At Russia 2018, the Sochi fixture list will include 6 games and welcome back 

Germany for their Group F match against Sweden  

 

10:10:43 But the actions gets underway with one of the most eagerly awaited matches 

of the group stages as European Champions Portugal take on Spain on the 

15th  of June.  

 

10:10:54 Next we take a closer look at Portuguese superstar Cristiano Ronaldo and the 

Argentinian magician he regularly jousts with for the title of the world’s best 

player, Lionel Messi. 

 

10:11:06 Using the CIES Football Observatory’s player rating system we’re going to 

compare their statistics in terms of chances created, taking on opponents, 

and shooting.  

 

10:11:15 So how do the best players in the world compare. 

 

10:11:18 In terms of taking on opponents Messi scores a near-perfect 99 out of 100 

compared to Ronaldo’s 69.  

 

10:11:26 With the Portugal forward now playing as a traditional number nine, his 

opportunities and need to beat a man are less. However, Messi likes to come 

deep to collect the ball. His low centre of gravity and quick turn of pace mean 

his ability to beat a man is without question. 

 

10:11:42 Both men score high for chances created but it is Messi who comes out on 

top with another near perfect 99 compared to Ronaldo’s 73. Playing in a 

deeper role than Ronaldo, Messi can often turn provider from wide and 

central areas. 

 



9 
 

10:11:57 When it comes to prowess in front of goal, both men score 99. They’ve 

netted an astonishing amount of goals in their careers and that doesn’t look 

like slowing down, even with both men now in their thirties. Ronaldo scored 

15 goals on the road to Russia, only bettered by Robert Lewandowski’s 16 in 

UEFA qualification. Whilst Messi scored some important goals to drag his 

underperforming Argentina to the finals. 

 

10:12:21 That means both players score 92 out of 100 on the CIES football index. 

Despite Messi coming out on top in two categories, Ronaldo has had a score 

of 99 for shooting for longer and that category is the most important when it 

comes to ranking forwards.  

 

10:12:37 With 10 Ballon d’Or awards between them, these two sit amongst the all 

time greats of the game and watching them perform will be a highlight this 

summer. 

 

10:12:49 From two star forwards to one of the standout goalkeepers of the 2014 

tournament, as Mexico’s Guillermo Ochoa relives his memorable heroics 

against hosts Brazil. 

 

Guillermo Ochoa, Goalkeeper (MEX) 

10:13:03 It was something really special, you hear the Mexican national anthem, and 

then you hear the Brazilian one and it was just amazing. 

 

10:13:14 And then you draw 0-0 against the home team, where luckily, everything 

went perfectly for me. 

 

10:13:22 I didn’t even think about what it would mean, what people would say about 

that save. 



10 
 

10:13:29 We were playing the match, I saw what happened, Dani centred the ball 

and I look at my defenders, I see someone starts running, I didn’t see that it 

was Neymar. 

 

10:13:42 And when he headers the ball, I just react; strength, speed, I put my arms 

out... And that was it.  

 

10:13:54 It was one of those matches that... things go well for you, you leave feeling 

positive. You close your eyes and manage to save all the goals. 

 

10:14:05 It was one of those matches that... I believe in God and believe he’s there 

with me, supporting me, making me unstoppable. And well, luckily, I did as 

a good job as I had to for my team. 

 

10:14:19 People congratulate me for that match, both Mexicans and non-Mexicans, 

which I think is the nicest part of it, that even being away from home, 

people remember me, they know who I am, they say things like, “You’re an 

amazing goalkeeper,” “What a great game you played in the World Cup,” “I 

already knew who you were, but that match...”. I think it’s a match that I’ll 

remember for the rest of my life. 

 

10:14:46 Next, on the latest Hyundai Anatomy of a Goal, we’re taking a look back at a 

fine team goal from one of the most exciting sides of the 2002 FIFA World 

Cup™. 

 

10:14:55 The FIFA World Cup™has a long history of shock results, and nations who 

belied their underdog status to reach the latter stages of the competition. 



11 
 

10:15:04 Back in 2002, there were three such teams, co-hosts Korea Republic, third-

placed finishers Turkey and first-time qualifiers Senegal, who shocked 

champions France in the tournaments opening game. 

 

Diafra Sakho, Forward (SEN) 

10:15:21 I think the fact of being young, of being 12 or 13, helps you remember 

better what you see during a FIFA World Cup.  

 

10:15:28 The games were shown in the morning in Senegal, so we would wake up 

around 6 or 7am for a game kicking off at 8am, and watch the game 

together.  Even though we were young back then, these are images which 

we will remember forever. 

 

10:15:44 The Lions of Teranga would further underline the quality that side possessed 

in the second match against Denmark, as midfielder Salif Diao finished off an 

outstanding counter-attacking equaliser. 

 

10:15:57 Replaying the action, as Henri Camara wins the ball back, Diao sets off from 

just outside the penalty area. Camara’s precise long pass is met by a clever 

touch from El Hadji Diouf, who finds his teammate. 

 

10:16:11 The midfielder plays a one-touch sweeping pass to Khalilou Fadiga, who runs 

at the defence.  

 

10:16:18 And as striker Soulamayne Camara pulls one defender wide, a slight slip from 

Jan Heintze in the middle leaves Diao free to score. 



12 
 

10:16:28 From behind, we can see the total distance covered by Diao, over 80m, to 

help start and finish the move – a ruthless counter attacking goal that had 

taken in nearly the whole field, with 5 telling passes and topped off with the 

finish it deserved. 

 

10:16:47 The team would go on to reach the Quarter Finals, where they were 

eliminated by Turkey. Despite defeat, Bruno Metsu’s side inspired a whole 

country, who are now looking forward to their second FIFA World 

Cup™appearance this summer, and hoping the current generation can 

emulate the class of 2002. 

 

10:17:07 Time for a modern day African success story now as we travel 2,900 

kilometres south of Moscow to take a look at the most decorated team in 

Africa. 

 

10:17:19 Ranked 31st at the time of the draw and with a population just shy of 100 

million, the Pharoahs of Egypt have won the African Cup of Nations a record 

7 times. So it’s somewhat of a surprise they’ve only made two appearances at 

the finals of the FIFA World Cup™.  

 

10:17:34 The last of those came 28 years ago at Italia 90. Drawn alongside England, the 

Republic of Ireland and the then defending European champions, the 

Netherlands, their only goal of the tournament came in their opening match 

against Leo Beenhakker’s Dutch side, Abdelghani’s late penalty securing them 

a richly deserved draw. 

 



13 
 

10:17:53 Egypt qualified with relative ease for this summer’s finals. An opening victory 

away to Congo set them on their way, finishing 4 points clear of Uganda in 

African qualifying Group E. 

 

Héctor Cúper, Coach 

10:18:05 For me, as a coach, and for everyone, all the staff, we feel a certain sense of 

pride at having been able to achieve it. And the most extraordinary thing is 

seeing everyone happy, the emotions that this has brought about.  

 

Ahmed Fathy, Defender 

10:18:25 It’s normal to face difficulties in matches, there is no easy or tough game. 

Thank God we determined the outcome, it’s the first time we’ve managed 

to qualify with games to spare, that made it a little easier. It was a little 

hard but thank God, we qualified. 

 

10:18:39 Scoring in all 4 of the victories that saw them top their qualifying group, 

Egypt’s Star Player is Mohammed Salah. A hero back home, he’s fast 

becoming an international superstar. He was the top scorer in England’s 

Premier League this season and played a pivotal role in Liverpool’s 

exhilarating Champions League campaign. 

 

Ahmed Fathy, Defender 

10:18:57 A lot of the fans say that our whole plan will revolve around Salah, that’s 

normal – all the Barcelona players plan around Messi. If you have a player 

like Salah, it’s okay to build the plan around him.  

 



14 
 

10:19:10 In the end, his success is definitely down to a lot of training. And yes, he will 

make a difference to us just as he does with Liverpool. 

 

Héctor Cúper, Coach 

10:19:20 The biggest influence that Salah has had on the Egypt team is purely being 

one more of the team. You’ll all be saying, “What does the manager mean 

by that?” A lot. He was just like the rest. I mean, he scored almost all of the 

goals. But he worked as hard as the rest, he ran like most of the others, he 

was always associated with the group, with working together. He was just 

one more. And that’s great. For me, it’s great. 

 

10:19:48 Along with Salah’s goals, it’s their coach Hector Cuper whose tactical acumen 

has got them to where they are. Appointed in March 2015, the Argentinian is 

a well-travelled and hugely experienced scholar of the game, twice leading 

Valencia to Champions League finals in the early 2000s. 

 

Héctor Cúper, Coach 

10:20:09 I realised that the players were up for anything.  

 

10:20:14 And that's what really makes me happy. Because when you've got a player 

who says, "Come on then, tell us. What have we got to do?" When they 

give you that freedom, or that possibility... I think that’s the openness these 

guys have. They have the modesty to say, "Well, we could do it like this, but 

you need to guide us.” 

 

 

 



15 
 

Saad Samir, Defender 

10:20:43 When the current coach came, the team started to come together. The 

coach began to discover which players would participate in the qualifiers. 

We started to dream of being at the World Cup. We took it one game at a 

time. We had great confidence in God and we were confident we could 

fulfil the dream. With the present squad and the technical staff, we dealt 

with it step by step until that dream came true.  

 

10:21:08 Saad Samir is one of a number of Egypt’s squad who play their football for 

one of the most decorated clubs in Africa. And this could prove their X-

Factor. 

 

10:21:17 Situated in the country’s capital, Cairo, Al Ahly have won Egypt’s domestic 

league a record 40 times, and no other African side has won more CAF 

Champions League titles than them. 

 

10:21:29 If Egypt can continue to transfer this successful club mentality through to the 

national team then the Pharoahs can have high hopes of progressing beyond 

the group stages at the FIFA World Cup™ for the 1st time. 

 

Saad Samir, Defender 

10:21:42 In the national team, you represent Al Ahly with your behaviour and your 

actions. On the field, before you represent your country you represent the 

place from which you came. So, it’s a responsibility for us as players of Al 

Ahly that we want our club to be at the top. 

 

 



16 
 

Ahmed Fathy, Defender 

10:22:02 We have high spirits and we hate to lose, because we are always playing in 

competitions, we don’t except to lose, our games rarely end in draws; that 

would be a bad day for us. It does have an effect, of course, but the 

personalities of Al Ahly players are strong because we have a lot of 

experience of African championships and we are always under pressure. 

 

10:22:30 Egypt have been drawn in Group A in Russia and their opening game will 

bring together two of the most potent goal-scorers currently on the planet – 

Egypt’s own Mo Salah, and Uruguay’s Luis Suarez. 

 

10:22:42 Four days later, they face the tournament hosts in Saint Petersburg before 

making the journey to Volgograd and maritime neighbours, Saudi Arabia. 

 

Saad Samir, Defender 

10:22:53 We all want to show our potential, and the World Cup is the best place for 

you to show that. The teams who play more matches shine and stand out. 

So our ambition is to qualify for the knock-out stages, which I don’t think is 

out of our reach, if God wills it. 

 

Héctor Cúper, Coach 

10:23:13 People get carried away by their emotions and, of course, they have really 

high expectations. And sometimes you can start to lose touch with reality, 

can’t you? And I always say, “You should always be aware of your own 

limitations in order to deal with anything.” But, well, I hope we do well. 

That’s what I’d like.  

 



17 
 

10:23:38 We end the show with the latest in our FIFA World Cup™ Firsts, as we head 

back to 2010 and the very first time that Africa hosted football’s showpiece. 

 

10:23:48 The 19th edition of the tournament marked the first time it had been held on 

the African continent, but unfortunately for South Africa, it also marked the 

first time the host nation was eliminated at the group stage.  

 

10:24:01 2006 winners Italy and runners-up France, also failed to reach the round of 

16 - the first time both teams from the previous final crashed out at the 

opening stage. 

 

10:24:13 In another first for South Africa 2010, the Honduras squad included 3 siblings 

– Jerry, Johnny and Wilson Palacios… while the game between Germany and 

Ghana the first brothers to play against each other for opposing nations - 

Jerome and Kevin-Prince Boateng. 

10:24:33 Germany and England’s Round of 16 tie became the first FIFA World Cup™ 

fixture between the long-term rivals to produce a winner before extra-time. 

 

10:24:44 The match also marked the biggest margin of defeat for England, with a 4-1 

loss compounded by Frank Lampard’s disallowed goal, which was later 

proven to have crossed the line. 

 

10:24:55 Spain tallied up a number of firsts during the 2010 tournament. 

 

10:25:01 Their one nil victory against Germany in the semi-finals meant they made it 

through to their first FIFA World Cup™ final.  



18 
 

10:25:09 And their subsequent victory against the Netherlands, thanks to that extra 

time goal from Iniesta, earnt them their first FIFA World Cup™ title, making 

them the 8th team to win the competition. 

 

10:25:20 Spain also became the first team to win the trophy having lost their opening 

game and the first European nation to win a tournament that was not hosted 

on European soil.  

 

10:25:32 That’s it for now, but join us next time as we continue on the Road to the 

2018 FIFA World Cup™ in Russia.

chapters.title: En route pour le Mondial N°15

Un programme soutenu par la ville de Sion, le canton et des partenaires privés, c'est un pas de plus pour l'avenir de toute la mobilité autonome où la communication entre l'environnement et les véhicules sera vital à ce stade, les 2 navettes autonomes sédunoise ont déjà transporté gratuitement plus de 38000 passagers prochaine apprentissage prévu, passer les ronds-points.

Oui, il nous a fait très peur, Stan Wawrinka puisqu'on était dans le 1er set sur le court Suzanne Lenglen, qui est juste derrière moi, il y avait 4 de Garcia Lopez 40 partout et, soudain, on a vu Stan Wawrinka se plaindre du genou, faire des exercices et demander un temps mort médical durant le jeu, même pas la fin du jeu, et là on se dit c'est autorisé un certes, mais c'est plutôt inhabituel et inquiétant, se pose alors la question du scénario catastrophe pour celui qui a gagné ici, à Roland Garros en 2015 mais qui a subi une double opération au genou, une greffe du cartilage et qui n'a joué cette saison que 4 petits matches heureusement plus de peur que de mal, puisqu'il a certes perdu la première manche, mais par compte, s'est ressaisie dans la 2ème qu'il a remporté 6 3 il a breaké maintenant dans la 3ème manche, ce qui est plutôt de bonne augure, parce qu'il a montré un tout autre visage un visage conquérant et rassurant pour ses supporters.
